text: This is a list of earthquakes in 2004. Only earthquakes of magnitude 6 or above are included, unless they result in damage and/or casualties, or are notable for some other reason. All dates are listed according to UTC time. ==Compared to other years== ==Overall== ===By death toll=== {| class="sortable wikitable" style="font-size:100%;" |- ! Rank ! Magnitude ! Death toll ! Location ! MMI ! Depth (km) ! Date |- | 1 | 9.1-9.3 | 227,898 | Indonesia, Sumatra offshore | | 30.0 | 26 December |- | 2 | 6.4 | 631 | Morocco, Al Hoceima | | 12.2 | 24 February |- | 3 | 6.6 | 68 | Japan, Chūbu | | 13.0 | 23 October |- | 5 | 6.3 | 35 | Iran, Baladeh | | 20.0 | May 28 |- | 4 | 7.5 | 23 | Indonesia, Alor | | 10.0 | 11 November |- | 5 | 5.1 | 18 | Turkey. Ağrı | | 5.0 | 2 July |} * Note: At least 10 dead ===By magnitude=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:100%;" |- ! Rank ! Magnitude ! Death toll ! Location ! Depth (km) ! Date |- | 1. | 9.2 | 227,898 | Indonesia, Sumatra offshore | 30 | 26 December |} * Note: At least 7.0 magnitude ==By month== ===January=== * A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck Guerrero, Mexico on January 1 at a depth of . ===February=== * Baumes-les-Dames earthquake on 23 February 2004, magnitude 5.1 earthquake struck Baume-les-Dames in a department of Doubs.https://www.azurseisme.com/4-4-Seisme-de-Baume-les-Dames.html Dept of 10 km. ===July=== * A magnitude 5.1 earthquake struck Doğubayazıt, Turkey on July 2 at a depth of . ===October=== * A magnitude 6.7 earthquake struck near Taiwan on October 15 mid-day local time at a depth of . The epicenter was located East of Su-ao, and southeast of Taipei, Taiwan. The quake was felt in the Ryukyu Islands as well as in Taiwan. ===November=== * A magnitude 7.5 earthquake struck Alor Island, Indonesia on November 11, at a depth of only . Thousands of casualties were reported, including 23 deaths. ===December=== * A magnitude 9.2 earthquake struck Sumatra, Indonesia on December 26, causing a destructive tsunami which killed at least 227,898 people, making it the deadliest tsunami ever recorded. The waves reached as far as Africa. ==References== 2004 Category:2004 natural disasters 2004
title: List of earthquakes in 2004
